UseCaseTitle: Autonomous AI Dashboard for Smart City Operations
Purpose: To provide city administrators with real-time, actionable insights across infrastructure, traffic, environment, and utilities through a unified AI-powered dashboard.
ExecSummary: Modern cities are increasingly equipped with IoT sensors across infrastructure, but struggle to consolidate and derive meaningful insights from siloed data. A real-time Smart City Dashboard powered by intelligent agents enables proactive governance, efficient operations, and citizen-centric services.
ExecSummaryKeyAsks: Consolidate city-wide data from various IoT systems
Enable real-time monitoring and anomaly detection
Visualize KPIs and trends across operations
Support decision-making for city planners and response teams
BusinessObjectives: Optimize city operations across traffic, utilities, and safety
Increase situational awareness for emergency response
Enhance public satisfaction through transparency and responsiveness
BusinessBenefits: Faster response times to city incidents or anomalies
Improved coordination across departments (utilities, transport, environment)
overview: This solution presents an agent-powered smart city dashboard that unifies data from diverse sensors and city services. Built using Node.js, MongoDB, and ECharts, it enables real-time visualization, AI-based pattern recognition, and operational alerts for smarter governance.
business: Governments worldwide are investing in smart infrastructure, but often lack a centralized command center that provides real-time oversight. This leads to delayed responses, fragmented decision-making, and underutilized IoT data streams.
approach: Data is ingested from traffic cameras, weather stations, utility meters, and public service endpoints. Intelligent agents process and normalize this data, detect anomalies, and update the dashboard UI in real-time. MongoDB acts as the time-series store, and ECharts renders interactive visualizations.
BusinessDrivers: Early detection of outages, congestion, or anomalies
Unified platform for public safety and operations
BusinessChallanges: Fragmented sensor data formats and protocols
Manual correlation of events across departments
FunctionalOverview: Real-Time Data Aggregation: Collects live data feeds from various municipal systems.
KPI Visualization: Renders metrics on energy usage, air quality, traffic congestion, water distribution, etc.
Anomaly Detection: AI-based logic triggers alerts for anomalies or threshold breaches.
Drill-down Insights: Stakeholders can explore granular data across zones and service categories.
Cross-Agency Coordination: Shared dashboard access ensures collaborative resolution and planning.

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: Continuously pulls and normalizes data from various smart infrastructure sources.
KeyFeatures: Support for REST, MQTT, and WebSocket protocols
Scalable ingestion for thousands of devices
BusinessImpact: Improves accuracy and timeliness of insights
Enables holistic understanding of city operations

FunctionalComponentDetails.Description: ECharts-based UI displays real-time KPIs and triggers alerts via business rules.
BusinessImpact: Enables proactive rather than reactive responses

SolutionOverview: AI-powered dashboard aggregating multi-source sensor data
Real-time city monitoring through unified visualizations
Node.js backend for data orchestration and API exposure
MongoDB stores time-series sensor and operational data
Supports policy simulation and what-if scenario planning
dataflow: IoT sensors feed data into the Aggregation Agent, which normalizes and streams it to MongoDB. The Anomaly Detection Engine evaluates incoming metrics against defined patterns or thresholds. Results are forwarded to the Visualization Layer and Alert Dispatcher for real-time UI updates and notifications.
design: A modular microservice architecture using Node.js for orchestration and ECharts for UI. Each functional unit (e.g., traffic, energy, environment) operates as a plug-and-play module. The system supports horizontal scaling for large smart city deployments.

cost.CAPEX: 70,000 - covers dashboard development, sensor integrations, and cloud infrastructure setup
cost.OPEX: 6,000/month - includes cloud compute, database, alerting, and support
